Year of release: 1967
Genre: Drama
Duration: 1:37:33

Director: Mark Osepyan

Starring: Alexander Korol'kov, Alexey Chernov, Valentine Vladimirov, Leo Jumpers, Gennady Saifulin, Ivan Kuznetsov, Natalia Rychagova, Valery Belyakov, Basil SHukshin, Hope Fedosov, Semyon Sokolovsky, D.Sharanova, D.Chukovsky, Valentine Telichkina, Arina Aleinikova

Description: He is not even twenty. They often get together to kill time, but they - no slackers. Work and even learn. Do not steal, drink in moderation, appreciate the friendship, cheer for the "Torpedo" or "Spartacus" and apparently satisfied with what they have ...

In 1968, the film was removed from the screen in 1988 reinstated to / from them. Bitter and released in rent.

"Three days of Viktor Chernyshev" quietly passed what is called the "second screen." But what was seen then, in 1967, except for the author's honesty, stiffness and anxiety in this outstanding and certainly far modest tape? Is that incredible marvel: the working guy, a representative of the hegemonic class, which according to established canons was supposed to be a hero, turned to the amazement of the audience, in the anti-hero. It was a revelation, but of those that are not supposed to publicly discuss, not to harm reviewers.
And the authors themselves - the young playwright Yevgeny Grigoryev and debutant director Mark Osepyan - hardly aware of the fact that they create a movie-milestone celebrated him end the "thaw" and the beginning of a new stage, which was later called "stagnant."

Valeria Gorelov.
